file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 21-51-13-07 - WATER SPRAY NOZZLE - CLEANING/PAINTING

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL WATER SPRAY NOZZLE - CLEANING/PAINTING EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedure to clean the water spray nozzles. This procedure is applicable to the two water spray nozzles. B. The water spray nozzles are installed in the ram-air inlet ducts, between the ram air valves and the dual heat exchangers, inside the forward lower fairing. C. To do this procedure, you must remove the water spray nozzles. D. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ALL 21-51-13-100-801-A WATER SPRAY NOZZLE - CLEANING EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 21-51-13 Page 1 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 21-51-13-100-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. WATER SPRAY NOZZLE - CLEANING A. General (1) This task gives the procedure to clean the water spray nozzle. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 21-51-13-000-801-A/400 WATER SPRAY NOZZLE - REMOVAL AMM TASK 21-51-13-400-801-A/400 WATER SPRAY NOZZLE - INSTALLATION IPC 21-51-00 COOLING PACK SYSTEM C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Compressed air source, 20 psi To clean the water spray nozzle available E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Stiff-bristle brush To clean the water spray nozzle 1 available Commercially Nylon fishing line, 1.7 mm (0.039 in) di- To clean the water spray nozzle 1 available ameter maximum F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) Commercially available Mild soap AR Commercially available Cloth AR G. Expendable Parts IPC REFERENCE ITEM QTY (VENDOR REFERENCE) Tiedown strap IPC 21-51-00 2 H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Outside the aircraft EMB-145 - AMM 1285 100-801-A/700 21-51-13 Page 2 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Remove the water spray nozzles ( AMM TASK 21-51-13-000-801-A/400). J. Cleaning of the Water Spray Nozzles (Figure 701) SUBTASK 140-002-A EFFECTIVITY: ONLY AIRCRAFT WITH SPRAY NOZZLE 145-25793 (1) Remove the tiedown strap (1) and the water-spray nozzle ejector (2) from the water- spray nozzle body (3). (2) Clean the water-spray nozzle ejector (2) and the water-spray nozzle body (3) with a stiff-bristle brush. (3) Wipe inside the water-spray nozzle ejector (2) with a Nylon fishing line. (4) Finish the cleaning of the water-spray nozzle ejector (2) and the water-spray nozzle body (3) with a cloth moistened with mild soap. (5) Blow the water-spray nozzle body (3) with compressed air at 20 psi. (6) Examine with backlight to see if there is obstruction inside the water-spray nozzle ejector (2). If so, clean it again or replace. (7) Install the water-spray nozzle ejector (2) and a new tiedown strap (1) on the water- spray nozzle body (3). K. Cleaning of the Water Spray Nozzles (Figure 702) SUBTASK 140-003-A EFFECTIVITY: ONLY AIRCRAFT WITH SPRAY NOZZLE 145-53171 (1) Remove the the water-spray nozzle ejector (2) from the water-spray nozzle body (1). (2) Clean the water-spray nozzle ejector (2) and the water-spray nozzle body (1) with a stiff-bristle brush. (3) Wipe inside the water-spray nozzle ejector (2) with a Nylon fishing line. (4) Finish the cleaning of the water-spray nozzle ejector (2) and the water-spray nozzle body (3) with a cloth moistened with mild soap. (5) Blow the water-spray nozzle body (1) with compressed air at 20 psi. (6) Examine with backlight to see if there is obstruction inside the water-spray nozzle ejector (2). If so, clean it again or replace. (7) Install the water-spray nozzle ejector (2) on the water-spray nozzle body (1). L. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Install the water spray nozzles ( AMM TASK 21-51-13-400-801-A/400).
